title: Worldbuilding - Your Turn! Part III
body: Been months and I'm bored. Let's talk about random worldbuilding ideas! Past topics include geography/climate (this was pre-map but I got stuff right!), food, language, music and instruments, and marriage and partnership. Since I did all those posts, a new region was revealed (Ixtal), and we've received more details on some others, so feel free to toss me whatever, even if I already talked about it a while ago.

The biggest reason why Sahn-Uzal rose to power was because his tribe found the iron deposits in the Ironspike Mountains, which allowed them to make weapons and armor superior to their rival nomadic tribes, who were still armed with hide and bone. It's why Mordekaiser associates himself with iron so much; it was the literal foundation of his empire.

Why Wukong and Ahri are related champs- 
>On Ahri's quest to find her tribe, she meets Wukong who's currently on his own while Yi handles his village cleansing thing. He agree's to escort her to some destination she's trying to reach, high-jinks happens, Wukong gains the ability to make clones in lore, Ahri finds her tribe and starts being taught about her history and such. Both them high five for getting character development and new lore, Wukong heads back to Master Yi to inform him his purpose for fighting is to keep people safe or something and Yi gets ready to test Wukong to see if he's ready to become a true Wuju Master (<---To be continued----)

Short, sweet, doesn't step on anyone's toes and the 8ish year old question of why they're listed as related champs get's answered, as well. Win/win for everyone involved.

My only concern would be the game modes, and if they would be fun or not. I think a simple 5v5 mode with all the champs and no crazy gimmicks that take away too much from your champ being the primary source of damage would be best. 

How about an indoor Halls of Demacia map, or an out door desert Shurima map? 

Not sure how many of these have been done, I recall the star guardian thing being different maps and being a coop mode which are both great ideas, I just had one complaint, and that was that it was limited to only start guardians.

Someone mentioned in another thread that Ionia seems to not have deities they look up to but in a land of magic, why would you look up to someone who is just magic like? They haven't done anything special. So I suggested that they look to Ancestors of great worth instead. Those that did great things for the people or land. 

This also raises the question of other religions and how things are worthshipped. Mainly due to the simple reason, their gods/deities whatever are literal beings. Anivia literally flies around Freljord, Volibear has followers, Illoai basically uses her god as a tool to fight and The Aspect of Sun inhabits that of Leona.

Do they believe in even higher powers? World creators or a 'one above all' so to speak? And what of Shurima? Their gods aren't gods, just men given power, they were a civilisation long before Ascension became a thing so did they worthship gods? 

(this the kind of thing you are looking for?)

They don't seem to have a named entity as a god, but a lot of them do revere "The Great Spirit of Ionia" whether this is an individual entity or a catch-all title for all of the spirits in Ionia, or a handy way to refer to their philosophy isn't clear.

It's a living part of their land and they do not outright "worship" it, but they do strive to maintain balance with the Great Spirit of Ionia and the land itself rewards them with food and shelter.

Yeah, a lot of Runeterra has some form of religion. Shurima worships the Sun, Ionia worships the spirit of the land (ancestors also get some time of day), Demacia loves the Winged Protector {{champion:10}} as well as having the Veiled Lady {{champion:25}} as part of their mythos, Noxus really likes Wolf, Pilt/Zaun has some stuff around the Gray Lady and {{champion:40}}, and of course there's Nagakabouros. Freljord even has multiple faiths or at least groups of deities; {{champion:34}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:516}} clash with the Three Sisters. But compared to other aspects of the world, not very much about these religions has been released. I hope to see more details laid down in Realms of Runeterra.

Since Ionia doesn't have an actual currency that I know of, I had to completely make up a coin-based currency for it to make roleplaying easier.

This raises the question of if Ionia does in fact have a currency and, if it does, how widely it is used in the nation?

I believe the main form of "currency" is simply trading goods and services for other goods and services, probably out of respect for the Vastaya who may or may not conform to such a thing as using real money. It may also be because Ionian is an archipelago where each province has its own ruling council(I think), thus likely making establishing a single form of currency difficult.
****
****
I also established that Jhin speaks/reads Piltovan/Zaunite(same place so the language is likely the same or has very few differences), Demacian, some Shuriman, and possibly Noxian in the same roleplay, as he was interacting with a Piltovan scientist and was teaching him Ionian, among other things

This is of course ignoring the "global language" theory because, really, that's no fun at all.

I wouldn't doubt that Jhin knows multiple languages. He's likely very smart, though no genius, and likely took the time to study them(willingly or otherwise, fuck you cabal) in the months following his release from prison, prior to his journey to Zaun. Though, of course, I doubt he'd really be fluent in any language outside of Ionian(which itself is likely made up of different dialects, with him speaking the Zhyun dialect). He likely knows just enough to not be horribly confused, basically. Enough to interact with people, know how to get around, and blend in convincingly.

I think other people/champions may be able to speak multiple languages as well, or at least have translators to do so for them.
****
****
Other shit includes...

* The stars have names according to the Targonians, at least some of them do, as Atreus is named after a star in Pantheon's constellation. But what about the sun and moon? Are they simply called the "sun" and "moon," or do they have names?


* I'm curious about the continental plates situation for Runeterra, or if it even has them at all. Did it have a supercontinent like our Pangaea at some point in its history? Is seismic activity something that happens, as well as other natural phenomena, like hurricanes, tornadoes, ect?


* Mass extinction events, natural or otherwise? How many times has the life on Runeterra been "reset," if it has been at all?


* Is the rest of Runeterra even inhabited anymore? We know there is more, but as far as I know, there has been no indication about any influence from the places outside of the 1/6th of Runeterra that we know of besides the fact that there was a mass migration of people(Ixtali) from a continent in the east. However, we still have no idea if the rest of the world is still inhabited or if it is plagued by the same issues as this 1/6th of the world(mainly the Void and Black Mist).


* Speaking of the other inhabitants of Runeterra, do they know what's going on in this small 1/6th of the world? There are multiple apocalyptic-scale threats present here after all, so you'd think _someone_ elsewhere would know about that. The Darkin, the Void, the World Runes. Not to mention the multiple wars going on, the various godly figures that are just running around, the demons, the Shadow Isles/Black Mist, ect.

Oh hey 4 Step!
- I'm somewhere between two ideas here... several regional currencies, and barter. Leaning toward barter as you mentioned.
- I can definitely see Jhin learning other languages for amusement and future use; it's probably become much easier to obtain resources on such things since the Noxian invasion ended. You mentioned other champions who are multilingual; I know Camille is one.
- We'll probably see more in Realms of Runeterra, which has some freaky Aspect concept art, but I'd expect the sun and moon to just go by whatever the local language calls them.
- The lore server established (alongside Bioluminescence) that Runeterra does, in fact, have tectonic plates! Give this a look. https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/457316449594245150/572216592423714836/Tectonics_Canon.png 
Considering Runeterra's also an Earth-like (and probably roughly Earth-sized) oblate spheroid, I would expect it to have similar weather patterns as well, though maybe with more magic.
- Mass extinction - Well... Look at the vastaya page. The intro got changed pretty recently. SOMETHING happened. Something BIG, and we'll hopefully see more soon!
- Now that's an audacious theory. I wonder if we'll learn anything in future content. Riot's got so much of that incoming!

Piltover/Zaun is one of the few regions of the world to get the full stack of seasons. Cold winters, hot summers, etc. It also means there is an absolutely absurd holiday business where inventors push the bill on making the most "in-season" creation just in time for any upcoming holiday. Unfortunately this also leads to holidays becoming more commercialized and with less "deep" meanings.

In my head void monsters can appear out of nowhere, mostly at densely populated areas, roaming the night and knocking on the doors of fearful citizens. Humming, whispers and bone scraping on stone can be heard resonating with the misty night's air. The creatures disappear into nothingness just like they appeared... unless some reckless citizen dared to catch a glimpse, seduced by curiosity and imagination. 

The monsters of the void know they were watched, feeling the gaze still burning on their shells. The reckless citizen, in the warmth of home, opens his curtains for one last quick look, but the void in all it's vileness stares back with brilliant pearly eyes, just a breath's distance from the window.

The screams would echo through the darkness, as a lesson for all nosy neighbors that curiosity...begets death.

I have no idea about actual void lore so I have no idea if my head canon could fit.

Yeah, that sounds more like demons. Voidspawn tend to come out of extremely conspicuous rifts, or Void-corrupted areas like Icathia.

I think that is the result of a little discrepancy in the lore. The Void have been re-characterized as a long dormant threat slowly leaking back into the world. Nobody should really know what they are at this point BESIDES the Frostguard and people living near Icathia, but when Tarics' unit is killed by Voidborn as he's taking a walk IN THE MIDDLE OF VALORAN WHERE VOID-SPAWN SHOULDN'T BE, he not only knows what they are, but also upon Ascension makes destroying the Void his main mission.

Like huh?
